body:
This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing. 

How can I reconcile this fact with my Christian faith?
body_html:
This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing.

How can I reconcile this fact with my Christian faith?
title: God Is The Author of Confusion

author.bio: GM of +Clownworld +News +Commentary +Conspiracy +Christianity +Prolife +Conservatives +MAGA and a few others
author.bio_html: GM of +ClownWorld +News +Commentary +Conspiracy +Christianity +ProLife +Conservatives +MAGA and a few others

body:
You are confused, so you equate that with God being the author of confusion and not wanting you to understand? That’s a quite leap in thinking. 

I find the Bible to be sensible in a lot of respects, Proverbs and Ecclesiastes are pretty direct life wisdom. 

The Bible is easier to understand when you put in it cultural context. 

I don’t know what issue you are specifically stuck on, but you might want to just study the theology of that. If you have any more specific to add than that can be addressed directly.
body_html:
You are confused, so you equate that with God being the author of confusion and not wanting you to understand? That’s a quite leap in thinking.

I find the Bible to be sensible in a lot of respects, Proverbs and Ecclesiastes are pretty direct life wisdom.

The Bible is easier to understand when you put in it cultural context.

I don’t know what issue you are specifically stuck on, but you might want to just study the theology of that. If you have any more specific to add than that can be addressed directly.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
1 Corinthians 14:33 of God's Word says he is not the author of confusion and it is impossible for God to lie. 

What part of the Bible do you find confusing?

When you get to a part you don't understand, pray for clarity and wisdom to understand. Ask church elders for guidance.

author.bio: Warrior of God, Helper of Man, Agitator of Souls.  Raised on computers, now living as a nomad.
author.bio_html: Warrior of God, Helper of Man, Agitator of Souls. Raised on computers, now living as a nomad.

body:
If you were to consider that what originates from Satan is what makes the bible confusing, would that fix the problem? As in, if a person reads it for the wrong reasons, or has the wrong expectations reading it, then Satan is influencing how it is being read, would you agree?

I definitely sympathize with the feelings you are having, as ive had the same thoughts and same feelings, *but* i also recognize many things out the bible, which though they once confused me, have become crystal clear over time.  It is not all crystal clear, but it says line upon line, precept upon precept;  understanding doesn't happen over night, it takes time. Reading a single sentence takes time, understanding that sentence often takes longer;  reading the bible takes a *long* time, understanding the bible takes a *looong* time, especially with all the standing confusion created by Satan.

By standing confusion i mean the secular church's concensus on how various scripture or portions thereof are to be interpreted.

But, is the bible not self-evidently true?  Is the wisdom contained therein not divine?
body_html:
If you were to consider that what originates from Satan is what makes the bible confusing, would that fix the problem? As in, if a person reads it for the wrong reasons, or has the wrong expectations reading it, then Satan is influencing how it is being read, would you agree?

I definitely sympathize with the feelings you are having, as ive had the same thoughts and same feelings, but i also recognize many things out the bible, which though they once confused me, have become crystal clear over time. It is not all crystal clear, but it says line upon line, precept upon precept; understanding doesn't happen over night, it takes time. Reading a single sentence takes time, understanding that sentence often takes longer; reading the bible takes a long time, understanding the bible takes a looong time, especially with all the standing confusion created by Satan.

By standing confusion i mean the secular church's concensus on how various scripture or portions thereof are to be interpreted.

But, is the bible not self-evidently true? Is the wisdom contained therein not divine?

body:
And also:

>Proverbs 22 - 17 Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.18 For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips. 19 That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee. 20 Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge, 21 **That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?**
body_html:
And also:

body:
3 churches within 5 miles of me have all doubled in size over the last ten years, and that's just immediately around me....and just the ones that are so obviously growing that it took no deep research to know that lol.

I'm curious to see if you'd be willing to openly say this about Buddhism, Islam, or any others to the people that believe in them.
body_html:
3 churches within 5 miles of me have all doubled in size over the last ten years, and that's just immediately around me....and just the ones that are so obviously growing that it took no deep research to know that lol.

I'm curious to see if you'd be willing to openly say this about Buddhism, Islam, or any others to the people that believe in them.

He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing. 

How can I reconcile this fact with my Christian faith?
post.body_html:
This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing.

post.title: God Is The Author of Confusion

body:
You are quite lost if that's your reasoning. We are developed because of our faith. They are stuck in the 9th *because of their faith*. Religion is not some equal-across-the-board concept. They are quite different and Islam, for example, is quite restricting in the development department. 

The west's problem is that good people with good intentions and good work ethic greatly prospered and made it too easy for people living now to live in comfort. now with each new generation the expectations are that comfort, ease and happiness is the goal in life, but we don't appreciate where that freedom to seek it came from or why it blossomed in the first place.

The west's problem is that good people with good intentions and good work ethic greatly prospered and made it too easy for people living now to live in comfort. now with each new generation the expectations are that comfort, ease and happiness is the goal in life, but we don't appreciate where that freedom to seek it came from or why it blossomed in the first place.

post.body:
This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing. 

How can I reconcile this fact with my Christian faith?
post.body_html:
This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing.

How can I reconcile this fact with my Christian faith?
post.title: God Is The Author of Confusion

body:
Hello friend, I would like to offer you some wisdom on this matter that came to me when I faced a similar issue throughout my theological studies. When it comes to the mysteries of scripture, there is two seemingly incompatible truths that that actually work in a harmony that may be beyond reason (but is certainly NOT contrary to it).

Faith is a like vast ocean where many valuable truths lie in deep crevices hidden below the depths that can help us further understand the glory of the cross firmly planted in the shores above. So whilst it’s important to go forth and explore these things, even those which at times manifest as trials which can test us to our limits and make us far the nature of our faith, it’s even more important to remember this:

The treasures that lie deep in the oceans of your faith pale in comparison to the riches that were won for you on the cross by the Lord Jesus. It’s can be dark, cold, and lonely in the furthest depths of theological rigor and scriptural investigation, and whilst I would never tell you to simply avoid exploring your faith, I want to offer this life saving counsel: know your limits.

Take breaks, come back to the warm shallows and remember that all of scripture points first and foremost to salvation, what Christ won for you on the cross. You will never discover absolutely everything there is to know about God in this lifetime, because such is the nature of God that He can not fit in our small minds. It is up to us to trust in Him, for he is always faithful to us. I do not mean to be scathing my brother, but I urge you to take a break, and if you have questions call don’t go at it alone. There is a healthy fellowship that I profit from greatly (spiritually, the most important kind of profits) which you would be welcome to join me in if you would like the companionship of brothers when speaking of the things of the Lord. Blessed are you, my friend, for you are not alone. Please do not hesitate to let me know if you are interested and I can provide you our link. 🙂
body_html:
Hello friend, I would like to offer you some wisdom on this matter that came to me when I faced a similar issue throughout my theological studies. When it comes to the mysteries of scripture, there is two seemingly incompatible truths that that actually work in a harmony that may be beyond reason (but is certainly NOT contrary to it).

Faith is a like vast ocean where many valuable truths lie in deep crevices hidden below the depths that can help us further understand the glory of the cross firmly planted in the shores above. So whilst it’s important to go forth and explore these things, even those which at times manifest as trials which can test us to our limits and make us far the nature of our faith, it’s even more important to remember this:

The treasures that lie deep in the oceans of your faith pale in comparison to the riches that were won for you on the cross by the Lord Jesus. It’s can be dark, cold, and lonely in the furthest depths of theological rigor and scriptural investigation, and whilst I would never tell you to simply avoid exploring your faith, I want to offer this life saving counsel: know your limits.

Take breaks, come back to the warm shallows and remember that all of scripture points first and foremost to salvation, what Christ won for you on the cross. You will never discover absolutely everything there is to know about God in this lifetime, because such is the nature of God that He can not fit in our small minds. It is up to us to trust in Him, for he is always faithful to us. I do not mean to be scathing my brother, but I urge you to take a break, and if you have questions call don’t go at it alone. There is a healthy fellowship that I profit from greatly (spiritually, the most important kind of profits) which you would be welcome to join me in if you would like the companionship of brothers when speaking of the things of the Lord. Blessed are you, my friend, for you are not alone. Please do not hesitate to let me know if you are interested and I can provide you our link. 🙂

body:
Not disagreeing with you, but that is not what this passage is saying. First of all, it's in the context of interpreting prophesies in church. The other thing is that the word confusion is actually ⲀⲔⲀⲦⲀⲤⲦⲀⲤⲒⲀⲤ (ΑΚΑΤΑΣΤΑΣΙΑΣ if your browser can't show that charset), which means confusion more in the sense of literal disorder or chaos, not difficulty understanding. This makes much more sense with the proceeding "but of peace". Basically, it's just Paul writing a letter to a church and in this part he is giving them advice on how to organize this process in a peaceful, respectful manner.

However in regards to the question, I think it depends.

This makes much more sense with the proceeding "but of peace". Basically, it's just Paul writing a letter to a church and in this part he is giving them advice on how to organize this process in a peaceful, respectful manner.

However in regards to the question, I think it depends.

parent.body:
1 Corinthians 14:33 of God's Word says he is not the author of confusion and it is impossible for God to lie. 

What part of the Bible do you find confusing?

When you get to a part you don't understand, pray for clarity and wisdom to understand. Ask church elders for guidance.

body: Because the mainstream religion is an empty, broken counterfeit that has been grossly misused for worldly purposes. Throughout history 90% of "churches" have done nothing but boast of their piousness and belittle others for failing their impossible set of "standards", most of which was just made up, all while they didn't even try to do so themselves! This isn't as bad anymore, but that's also because the fake churches aren't as prevalent now. However, now the media is focusing only on those remaining ones and blaming that on the true believers!

post.body:
This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing. 

How can I reconcile this fact with my Christian faith?
post.body_html:
This is a bit random but ~ I think God IS the author of confusion. For so many reasons, but basically, the bible is incredibly difficult to understand. So difficult, I don't think its a stretch to call it confusing.

How can I reconcile this fact with my Christian faith?
post.title: God Is The Author of Confusion

body: Do not blame God for your being unable to understand His Word: this is a trap which many succumb to, and which also causes many to apostatize. This confusion may be averted by prayer and studious meditation upon the Bible, alongside apt research of history, context, and historical Patristic interpretations thereof (at least that’s how I’ve overcome my confusions).
body_html: Do not blame God for your being unable to understand His Word: this is a trap which many succumb to, and which also causes many to apostatize. This confusion may be averted by prayer and studious meditation upon the Bible, alongside apt research of history, context, and historical Patristic interpretations thereof (at least that’s how I’ve overcome my confusions).
